definition: to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to give to the departed/to confer (a title) posthumously
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
lit. pick orchids and present peonies (idiom); fig. presents between lovers

sentences.english: Learn how to measure aluminum foil to wrap presents in this free gift wrapping video.
sentences.chinese: 学习如何测量铝箔包装在此免费赠包装视频。

sentences.english: The second chapter will study the process of the act development.
sentences.chinese: 第二章论述了赠地学院法案的发展过程。

sentences.english: Professor Smith served as adviser to the President.
sentences.chinese: 史密撕教授赠做过总统的拓别顾问。

sentences.english: What about Vogue? This issue comes with a movie poster.
sentences.chinese: 来本《时尚》怎么样？这一期的还赠电影海报。

sentences.english: In return, the recipients promised to pray for the dead relatives of the donors.
sentences.chinese: 作为回报，接受食物的人要为赠饼者死去的亲属祷告。

sentences.english: The third chapter will study the process of the act pass.
sentences.chinese: 第三章论述了赠地学院法案的通过过程。

sentences.english: Please accept these coupons as our Christmas gift to you.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这些赠劵作为我们送给您的圣诞礼物。

sentences.english: Let my love; like sunlight; surround you yet give you illumined freedom.
sentences.chinese: 让我的爱如阳光般将你拥抱，并赠你奇丽的自在。

sentences.english: What about Vogue? This issue comes with movie posters .
sentences.chinese: 来本《时尚》吧，这个月的还赠电影海报。

sentences.english: Women invade Shopping Center in nothing but bras, panties and high heels.
sentences.chinese: 英国以超市出台促销策略，女士只穿内衣购物赠礼券。

sentences.english: A flower was offered to me.
I make piles of the pot stickers for my neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 我做了成堆的锅贴赠邻居。

sentences.english: In years for strings, give you stunning songs.
sentences.chinese: 以岁月为弦，赠你惊世情歌。

sentences.english: These you presented to me you fish-shaped island.
sentences.chinese: 鱼形之岛你曾赠我这么些美。

definition: (honorific) to present/to give as a present
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
(of a gift) to be a small token of one's feelings
variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
